sendBaseMessage(uint32,bytes32,uint32,by.notice: Send a message to the recipient located on destination domain.

sendSystemMessage(uint32,uint32,bytes).notice: Send a system message to the destination domain.

verifyAttestation(uint256,bytes,bytes,by.notice: Verifies a state from the snapshot, that was used for the Notary-signed attestation. Does nothing, if the state is valid (matches the historical state of this contract). Slashes the attestation signer, if the state is invalid.

verifyAttestationWithProof(uint256,bytes.notice: Verifies a state from the snapshot, that was used for the Notary-signed attestation. Does nothing, if the state is valid (matches the historical state of this contract). Slashes the attestation signer, if the state is invalid.

verifySnapshot(uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: Verifies a state from the snapshot (a list of states) signed by a Guard or a Notary. Does nothing, if the state is valid (matches the historical state of this contract). Slashes the snapshot signer, if the state is invalid.

verifyStateReport(bytes,bytes).notice: Verifies a snapshot report signed by a Guard.  - Does nothing, if the report is valid (if the reported snapshot is invalid).  - Slashes the Guard otherwise (meaning the reported snapshot is valid, making the report invalid).

sendBaseMessage(uint32,bytes32,uint32,by.details: Recipient has to conform to IMessageRecipient interface, otherwise message won't be delivered.

params.optimisticPeriod: Optimistic period for message execution on destination chain
params.recipient: Address of recipient on destination chain as bytes32
params.requestPayload: Payload with message execution request on destination chain
params.tipsPayload: Payload with information about paid tips

sendSystemMessage(uint32,uint32,bytes).details: This could only be called by SystemRouter, which takes care of encoding/decoding the message body. The message body includes the sender and the recipient of the system message. Note: function is not payable, as no tips are required for sending a system message.

params.optimisticPeriod: Optimistic period for message execution on destination chain

verifyAttestation(uint256,bytes,bytes,by.details: Will revert if any of these is true:  - Attestation payload is not properly formatted.  - Attestation signer is not an active Notary.  - Attestation root is not equal to Snapshot Merkle Root.  - Snapshot payload is not properly formatted.  - State index is out of range.  - State does not refer to this chain.

returns.isValid: Whether the requested state is valid.                          Notary is slashed, if return value is FALSE.

verifyAttestationWithProof(uint256,bytes.details: Will revert if any of these is true:  - Attestation payload is not properly formatted.  - Attestation signer is not an active Notary.  - Attestation root is not equal to Merkle Root derived from State and Snapshot Proof.  - Snapshot Proof's first element does not match the State metadata.  - Snapshot Proof length exceeds Snapshot tree Height.  - State payload is not properly formatted.  - State index is out of range.  - State does not refer to this chain.

params.snapProof: Proof of inclusion of provided State's Left Leaf into Snapshot Merkle Tree
params.stateIndex: Index of state in the snapshot
params.statePayload: Raw payload with State data to check

returns.isValid: Whether the requested state is valid.                          Notary is slashed, if return value is FALSE.

verifySnapshot(uint256,bytes,bytes).details: Will revert if any of these is true:  - Snapshot payload is not properly formatted.  - Snapshot signer is not an active Agent.  - State index is out of range.  - Snapshot state does not refer to this chain.

returns.isValid: Whether the requested state is valid.                          Agent is slashed, if return value is FALSE.

verifyStateReport(bytes,bytes).details: Will revert if any of these is true:  - Report payload is not properly formatted.  - Report signer is not an active Guard.

returns.isValid: Whether the provided report is valid.                          Guard is slashed, if return value is FALSE.
